channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla Sales Fall as Elon Musk Focuses on Self-Driving Cars
item.description: The company has devoted resources to autonomous driving rather than developing new models to attract car buyers.

item.title: Scattered, smothered, and surcharge free: Waffle House takes its egg surcharge off the menu
item.description: Chain had been charging an extra 50 cents per egg.

item.title: Teach for All CEO Wendy Kopp says she’s cracked the code on jet lag—and hasn’t experienced it at all since adopting the trick
item.description: Kopp's technique aligns well with the science behind jet lag.

item.title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Strikes Down 1849 Abortion Ban
item.description: After the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in 2022, Republican prosecutors in Wisconsin said they intended to enforce the old law.

item.title: Caitlin Clark’s new Nike sneakers sold out within minutes. Now the resale market is booming
item.description: Prices for the Kobe V Protro on the secondary market are already topping $350.

item.title: How Republican E.V. Cuts Could Put U.S. Carmakers Behind China
item.description: China’s lead in electric vehicle technology, which is already huge, could become insurmountable if incentive programs are slashed, auto experts and en...

item.title: Zillow CEO Jeremy Wacksman is using AI to transform the real estate industry—for buyers, sellers, and agents
item.description: “The one thing we found over the 20 years is anytime you can bring technology to the process, people will consume it," Wacksman told Fortune.

item.title: Figma has filed for an IPO—here are 7 key takeaways
item.description: Design software company Figma has filed for an IPO, which is expected to raise up to $1.5 billion.

item.title: Solar Industry Says Republican Policy Bill Would Cede Production to China
item.description: A revival of U.S. solar panel manufacturing that began during the first Trump administration could end with the phasing out of tax incentives for clea...

item.title: How Immigration Could Muddy the Jobs Numbers
item.description: Job growth is expected to fall this year, adding to pressure on the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates. But the slowdown might reflect a smaller la...

item.title: Scientist Use A.I. To Mimic the Mind, Warts and All
item.description: To better understand human cognition, scientists trained a large language model on 10 million psychology experiment questions. It now answers question...

item.title: Rachel Reeves in Tears in UK Parliament As Questions Are Raised Over Her Role
item.description: Rachel Reeves, Britain’s most senior finance official, appeared visibly upset in the House of Commons on Wednesday, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer was...

item.title: Hundreds of Small Earthquakes Rattle Remote Islands in Japan
item.description: More than 800 tremors have shaken the southwestern Tokara Islands over the past 11 days, including a 5.6-magnitude quake on Wednesday.

item.title: Europe’s Heat Wave Persists, Moving Eastwards
item.description: The heat wave moved toward Germany after affecting southwestern Europe, including Spain and France, earlier this week.

item.title: What to Know About the Heat Wave in Europe
item.description: Weather agencies have warned of a third day of high temperatures that in some places have climbed well above 100 degrees Fahrenheit, or more than 40 d...
